title: Whale Migration
description: A quick win: understand Whale Migration.

hook.text: Gray whales migrate 20,000 km round trip every year â€” the longest of any mammal.

buildup.text: They feed in cold Arctic waters rich with krill, then swim south to breed.

discovery.text: Humpback whales navigate using Earth's magnetic field like a built-in compass.

twist.text: Whale songs travel thousands of km through ocean. Males compose new songs each season.

climax.text: When whales dive deep and surface to breathe, their feces fertilize phytoplankton.

punchline.text: Whales sing, navigate by magnetism, and fertilize the ocean. They're ecosystem engineers.
